title: Ticket #7218: Wrong GCE credentials used for some requests
description:
When the Google Cloud credentials database has credentials for multiple accounts, the gce_gahp doesn't always fetch the credentials for the correct account. This can lead to requests failing unexpectedly.

Some attempts to fetch credentials in the gce_gahp don't include the account name. In these cases, the reader code picks a random account, which may not be the correct one. This is primarily happening for requests to check the status of a previously-issued command.
remarks:
2019-Sep-03 15:52:22 by jfrey:
Also, the lifetime of an access token is being misread. The first digit of the number is being dropped. That causes must more frequent requests to refresh the token.
